title: Drawing (France), ca. 1900
medium: Pen and ink with watercolors on white paper
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux, to which it was added in 1906.  Copy after ceiling painting [formerly 1911-28-59-s] sold to the Philadelphia Museum of Art., 1947.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Rendering of a painted ceiling: Apollo personifying poetry - horizontal rectangle - in the centre, an oval medallion showing Apollo seated on a cloud bank playing his harp and attended by three putti - the enframement consists of four trophies of military subjects, flower garlands, medallions at the corners, and simulated apertures open to the sky, in which stand urns.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing (France), ca. 1900. Pen and ink with watercolors on white paper. 
Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-59-b
